channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ヒット曲のカタログを買い取るレコードレーベル、Reservoir Mediaのゴルナー・コスロシャヒCEOに、著作権、ジェネレーティブAIの影響などについてQ&A（Nilay Patel/The Verge）
item.description:
Nilay Patel / The Verge:
Q&A with Golnar Khosrowshahi, the CEO of Reservoir Media, a record label that buys catalogs of hit songs, on copyright, generative AI's impact, and more  —  The publisher behind the songwriting copyrights to some of the most popular music ever recorded doesn't think AI spells doom for the industry.

item.title: YouTubeは、今年初めの「小さな実験」の後、広告ブロッカーのユーザーに広告を許可するかYouTube Premiumを試すよう促す「世界的な取り組みを開始した」と述べている（Emma Roth/The Verge）。
item.description:
Emma Roth / The Verge:
YouTube says it “launched a global effort” to encourage users with ad blockers to allow ads or try YouTube Premium, after a “small experiment” earlier this year  —  YouTube is broadening its efforts to crack down on ad blockers.  The platform has “launched a global effort” …

item.title: SmartNewsのコンテンツ担当副社長リッチ・ジャロスロフスキーは、年末に常勤職を退く予定だ。
item.description:
Chris Roush / Talking Biz News:
SmartNews VP of Content Rich Jaroslovsky plans to step down from a full-time job at year's end; Wendy Bounds is taking over and Bernie Davis' role will expand  —  Rich Jaroslovsky, vice president of content and chief journalist at SmartNews, sent out the following to his colleagues on Tuesday:

item.title: TikTok、YouTube、Instagramなどでニュースを報道・集約するクリエイターたちを見てみよう。
item.description:
Taylor Lorenz / Washington Post:
A look at some of the creators who report and aggregate news on TikTok, YouTube, Instagram, and more, as people under 35 move away from traditional news outlets  —  One recent study concluded consumers are looking for news that “feels more relevant,” giving a boost to creators on social media

item.title: 情報筋フォーブスのオーナーはルミナーCEOオースティン・ラッセルに8億ドルの入札を最終決定するよう2週間以上与える、ロシア人幹部マゴメド・ムサエフ氏は投資を否定（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Sources: Forbes' owners give Luminar CEO Austin Russell two more weeks to finalize his $800M bid; Russian executive Magomed Musaev denies investing in the deal  —  Austin Russell, the 28-year-old Luminar Technologies CEO who is seeking to buy Forbes, has requested an extension of a Nov. 1 deadline …

item.title: フォーブスのジャーナリストによると、ロシア人実業家マゴメド・ムサエフがフォーブスの新たなオーナーになったと報じられたことで、機密情報の提供を拒否する情報筋もいるという（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Forbes journalists say some sources are refusing to give them sensitive information due to Forbes' new reported ownership by Russian businessman Magomed Musaev  —  The Scoop  —  Forbes journalists have told the publication's management that some sources are refusing to share sensitive information …

item.title: マイクロソフト・スタートが女性の死に関する記事の隣にAIが作成した世論調査を配置したことで、ガーディアンは評判を傷つけられたとしている（Dan Milmo/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Dan Milmo / The Guardian:
The Guardian says its reputation was damaged after Microsoft Start placed an AI-generated poll about a woman's death next to the outlet's article about her  —  Publisher says poll speculating on cause of woman's death that appeared next to Guardian article caused ‘significant reputational damage’

item.title: Artforumの編集者3人がEICの解雇で辞職、アーティストやアートライターはペンスキー傘下のArtforum、ARTnews、Art in Americaに記事を書かないと誓約（Artnet News）
item.description:
Artnet News:
Three Artforum editors quit after the EIC was fired; artists and art writers have pledged not to write for Penske-owned Artforum, ARTnews, and Art in America  —  Artists and writers have signed a petition to boycott the publication alongside others owned by Penske Media.

item.title: ニュース・メディア・アライアンス調査：開発者はLLMを訓練するために、一般的なウェブコンテンツよりも記事に依存している。
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
News Media Alliance study: developers rely on articles more than generic web content to train LLMs; the NMA says this shows that AI companies violate copyright  —  The News Media Alliance, a trade group that represents newspapers, says that A.I. chatbots use news articles significantly more than generic content online.

item.title: TikTokとDistroKid、インディペンデント・アーティストの楽曲をTikTok Musicに提供する契約を締結、DistroKidのアーティストはすでにTikTokに楽曲を追加するオプションを持っている（Mia Sato/The Verge）
item.description:
Mia Sato / The Verge:
TikTok and DistroKid sign a deal to bring songs by independent artists to TikTok Music; DistroKid artists already have the option to add their music to TikTok  —  Independent artists using DistroKid to share their music will now have another avenue on TikTok.

item.title: KKR、16.2億ドルでのサイモン＆シュスター社買収を完了、米出版業界に大きな変化をもたらす。
item.description:
New York Times:
KKR completes its $1.62B Simon & Schuster acquisition, marking a major shift in the US publishing industry; KKR plans to offer an employee profit-sharing model  —  The process of selling Simon & Schuster has been long and tumultuous, and was waylaid by an earlier antitrust suit.

item.title: パンチボール・ニュースの共同設立者であるジェイク・シャーマンのプロフィールは、キャピトル・ヒルのドラマに関する実況中継をXに投稿し、DCの新鮮な情報に対する底なしの欲求を満たしている（Jesús Rodríguez/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Jesús Rodríguez / Washington Post:
A profile of Punchbowl News co-founder Jake Sherman, whose play-by-play posts on X about Capitol Hill's dramas feed DC's bottomless appetite for fresh intel  —  Jake Sherman wanted the world to know about his team's latest scoop.  —  BREAKING NEWS: DIANNE FEINSTEIN HAS PASSED AWAY AT 90, he wrote on X.

item.title: ローリング・ストーンは報道機関ではない」とイスラエルが批判的な報道をしたベテラン紛争記者ジェシー・ローゼンフェルドの記者証を拒否（Ryan Bort/Rolling Stone）
item.description:
Ryan Bort / Rolling Stone:
Israel denies press credentials to seasoned conflict reporter Jesse Rosenfeld after his critical coverage, saying “Rolling Stone is not a news organization”  —  The Netanyahu administration has denied a press credential to Jesse Rosenfeld, who has reported on the prime minister and the war

item.title: GBニュースの共同経営者であり、英国最大級の政治評論サイト「UnHerd」の創設者であるポール・マーシャルがテレグラフ紙を買収する際のプロフィール（Samuel Earle/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Samuel Earle / The Guardian:
A profile of Paul Marshall, GB News co-owner and founder of UnHerd, one of the biggest websites for political commentary in the UK, as he bids for The Telegraph  —  UnHerd has quickly become one of the biggest sites for political commentary in the UK, and now the hedge fund founder behind it …

item.title: イスラエルとハマスの戦争のような重要なイベント報道から広告を削除するブランドは、これらのニュースサイクルのニュースパブリッシャーの報道の非効率的な収益化につながる（Mark Stenberg/Medialyte）
item.description:
Mark Stenberg / Medialyte:
Brands removing ads from critical event coverage, like the Israel-Hamas war, leads to inefficient monetization of news publishers' coverage of these news cycles  —  A song to read by: “Kid Charlemagne,” by Steely Dan  —  What I'm reading: “The Rachel Papers,” by Martin Amis  —  The week that was
